item.title: About
item.description:
About

,
#_mouseOverEnlarge { 
	margin: 5px 0 5px 0;
	color:#3399FF; 
	border-bottom:1px solid #333;
	padding:8px 5px 10px 8px;
	}
	
#_mouseOverEnlarge div { 
	text-transform: uppercase; 
	color: #eee; 
	font: 15px Helvetica, Arial, Sans-Serif;
	-webkit-transition: all 0.12s ease-out;
    -moz-transition: all 0.12s ease-out;
    -o-transition: all 0.12s ease-out;
	}
	
#_mouseOverEnlarge div:nth-child(1) 
	{ font-size: 55px; 
	letter-spacing: 1px;
	}
	
#_mouseOverEnlarge div:nth-child(2) { 
	font-size: 28px; 
	letter-spacing: 0.7px; 
	}
	
#_mouseOverEnlarge div:nth-child(3) { 
	font-size: 18px; 
	letter-spacing: 0.2px; 
	}
	
#_mouseOverEnlarge div:nth-child(4) { 
	font-size: 14px; 
	}
	
#_mouseOverEnlarge div:hover {
	-webkit-transform: scale(1.1);
	-moz-transform: scale(1.1);
	-o-transform: scale(1.1); 
	text-shadow: 3px 3px 3px #333; 
	}
	
#_mouseOverEnlarge a {
	color: #fe4902;
	text-decoration: none; 
	}
,
<script>
	  (function(i,s,o,g,r,a,m){i['GoogleAnalyticsObject']=r;i[r]=i[r]||function(){
	  (i[r].q=i[r].q||[]).push(arguments)},i[r].l=1*new Date();a=s.createElement(o),
	  m=s.getElementsByTagName(o)[0];a.async=1;a.src=g;m.parentNode.insertBefore(a,m)
	  })(window,document,'script','//www.google-analytics.com/analytics.js','ga');

	  ga('create', 'UA-55185963-1', 'auto');
	  ga('require', 'displayfeatures');
	  ga('send', 'pageview');
</script>
,,

This is not my job, it is my passion.Currently: Full-Stack ASP.NET C# Software Engineer
B.S. in Computer Science from Chapman University (2016)

,
  1. I code with an enterprise standards in mind no matter what the project
,
  1. I’m used to working on large code-bases, and know how to approach them
  2. I do not re-invent, I extend off what is available and build up
  3. Self-motivated/driven and confident in my abilities
  4. I am not book-smart, I am code-smart, I use the tools available and avoid the grunt work of memorizing and focus more on the overall design and structure
  5. I learn best by doing, and absorbing knowledge from others
  6. I bring much more than being a good developer to a team
,

The non-coding part of me

,

Huge fan of electronic music, and closely linked to the industry.
Love LED’s, especially Philips HUE.
I enjoy fishing, but rarely catch anything.
Strong love for animals, especially dogs.
Above all
I am fortunate that I have a supportive, amazing girlfriend who puts up with the ridiculous amount of LED’s I have, and coding for multiple days straight. She has inspired me in a lot of ways to develop software that will improve quality of life for those in need, and to give back more than ever.

item.title: Software Engineer: Full-Stack ASP.NET C# MVC (Remote)
item.description:
Software Engineer: Full-Stack ASP.NET C# MVC (Remote)

,

Employer: VIVA Physicians

,

Daily workflow:

,

  • - Frameworks: ASP.NET Razor/MVC, AngularJS, EntityFramework,
  • - Code Management: Team Foundation Server (TFS) w/ Git
  • - Site Management: Internet Information Services (IIS)

item.title: Map-Wall Live January 14th, 2017 at the California Science Center in Los Angeles!
item.description:
,

Map-Wall Live January 14th, 2017 at the California Science Center in Los Angeles!

,

We went live January 14th, 2017! Check out the exhibit I did all the coding for at the California Science Center in Los Angeles. Map-Wall is simple to use and requires users to point the spotlight at one of the several points of interest on the map and press the trigger, which causes information on the monitor to be displayed about the selected point.
This projects backend was written in all C++ that leveraged ultraDMX Micro for interfacing with DMX512, SEI Absoluter Encoder Comm Protocol for reading (X,Y) coordinates, and U-HID for the LED Push Buttons on the spotlight device.
The frontend parses JSON generated by an Excel file filled out by the exhibit currator which the code supports English and Spanish which users can change with a button press on the base of the device. The frontend is generated on the fly using basic HTML,CSS, and Javascript leveraging the dojo toolkit. All points are pre-calibrated for each station with extra space for more in the future.
This has been one of my favorite projects I have done thus far. It is is awesome to see people of all ages interacting with and enjoying the exhibit!
